definition[0]: to say something in a loud, sad, and complaining way
example[0]: ‘But what shall I do?’ Bernard wailed.
definition[1]: to cry out with a long high sound, especially because you are very sad or in pain
example[1]: Somewhere behind them a child began to wail.
definition[2]: to make a long high sound
example[2]: The wind wailed in the chimney.
